answers.answer: Hi,Cortisol is termed as stress hormone and high cortisol levels indicate that you may be under stress. Other causes like hormonal imbalances, diabetes, high BP, thyroid dysfunction, Cushings disease result in high cortisol levels.Anxiety and stress can cause numbness and high cortisol levels so can diabetes and Thyroid dysfunction.This requires further clinical evaluation, please get it done. In the meantime make sure to eat your meals on time, drink plenty of water and do some deep breathing exercises daily.Thanks

question: I am a fairly physically active 26 year old woman.  I have been getting very lightheaded when sitting up from lying down, and also when I stand up.  I have got examined by my physician and all that showed up was a high cortosol level of 726.  I am 5'8 1/2 and weigh 133lbs.  This week I started experiencing numbness in my left hand and now tonight my left foot is numb now.  What do you think is happening to me?
title: Numbness in left foot and left hand w lightheadedness
